title: How to Create a Line Rider 2 Unbound Custom Rider

steps.headline: Create a new folder for your rider.
steps.description: It should be named something that you can remember.

steps.headline: Open up Line Rider 2's rider art files.
steps.description: The directory should usually be "My Computer - Local disk - Program Files - LineRider2 - Media - Art - rider - Bosh."

steps.headline: There should be a ton of files named things like "Rider_Sled_Full" or things like that.
Open up an image editing program.
steps.description: And yes, it CAN be done with Adobe Photoshop Elements.

steps.headline: Make a body part.
steps.description: This is easier said than done. Start with the small stuff, then work up to the big things.

steps.headline: Apply an alpha channel to the body part.
steps.description: This will make sure that the body part will not show up as a big white square with a picture.

steps.headline: Now flatten the image.
steps.description: I have no idea what this will do, but flatten it anyway.

steps.headline: Load up the alpha channel, then save it into the folder you made.
steps.description: It should be saved as a TGA file. If there is a box that's checked, and says "As a copy", un-check it.

steps.headline: Once your rider is finished, rename the folder you made "Bosh".
Open up the rider art program files again, and name the Bosh Folder in the program files "Real Bosh" so you don't lose the real Line Rider.
Drag the folder you made into the rider art files, between Bosh and Chaz.
Load up Line Rider 2.

text: Create a new folder for your rider. It should be named something that you can remember. Open up Line Rider 2's rider art files. The directory should usually be "My Computer - Local disk - Program Files - LineRider2 - Media - Art - rider - Bosh." There should be a ton of files named things like "Rider_Sled_Full" or things like that. THOSE are Bosh's body parts. Open up an image editing program. And yes, it CAN be done with Adobe Photoshop Elements. Make a body part. This is easier said than done. Start with the small stuff, then work up to the big things. Apply an alpha channel to the body part. This will make sure that the body part will not show up as a big white square with a picture. Now flatten the image. I have no idea what this will do, but flatten it anyway. Load up the alpha channel, then save it into the folder you made. It should be saved as a TGA file. If there is a box that's checked, and says "As a copy", un-check it. Repeat for each body part.  Once your rider is finished, rename the folder you made "Bosh".  Open up the rider art program files again, and name the Bosh Folder in the program files "Real Bosh" so you don't lose the real Line Rider.  Drag the folder you made into the rider art files, between Bosh and Chaz.  Load up Line Rider 2. If you did it right, when you press play, your rider will be on a sled!!!! :)
